children.subject: I'm also considering taking both of these classes next semester, and very anecdotally I've heard 127 is difficult but relatively low-workload. I'm hoping to hear more people's opinions though.

history.content:
I took it last semester with Byan vs 170 by Rao, personally speaking I think 127 takes me more time.

The class puts 40-50% on HW and each HW is out of like 30 points. I disliked this since you are forced to spend more time making sure everything doesn't go wrong. Materials are difficult but I found Byan explain things well if you can keep up with his pace. Though curve seems alright, many researchers, 189 TAs, people with a lot of A+s I know took 127 that semester and you should think about the curve carefully. From my friends who take the class this semester, other instructors tried to make the class easier for undergrads by giving a lot of hints on homework and reduce difficulty. But the class material is just as difficult for this semester. Not sure what will happen next semester

children.subject: @student answerer, could you elaborate a bit about the difficulty of 127 with Bayen? The distribution from last semester looks nice enough (even if it’s worse than El Ghaoui’s), but I remember hearing that the class was really difficult to get a good grade in.

history.content: I know the two classes are completely different, and am planning on taking both. I'm just curious as to which has a heavier workload, so I can figure out what the best time to take it is
history.subject: CS 170 vs. EECS 127 Workload
